Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Recommend highly.”
Reviews.Author: Majik_12
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms. Very clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Loved the warm chocolate cookies on arrival & so did my dog who ate almost half of mine! Lots of pillows. Large bath towels. Close to shopping mall and restaurants. No hesitation in recommending hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay until the elevator stopped working and they still saved the day”
Reviews.Author: karen g
Reviews.Content: I was there for a National Specialty Dog Show. That means lots of dogs (papillons) in a hotel that doesn't allow them. They handled it wonderfully. Thoughtful, respectful and attentive. The accommodations were large two room suites with very comfortable beds and TVs in each room. Nice restaurant and atrium area with a bar. The day we were to leave the elevators stopped working. We were on the 4th floor and had multiple dog crates, etc. to get down to our car. Walking the stairs once loaded down was more then enough. They graciously allowed our group to use the service elevator. Saved the day!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, in the heart of shopping & food.”
Reviews.Author: multigman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location for shopping and food. Rooms are good size, with a separate bedroom. Friendly staff. The only downside is very low water pressure in sink and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jodacious
Reviews.Content: As a hilton member we upgraded to a corner suite which was very large and accommodated two adults and two children very nicely. The convenient location to the airport, mall and freeway was just what we desired. The indoor pool was nice and not crowded on a Sat. night. The warm cookies were enjoyed by all four of us. The bed was very comfortable, but the pull out couch was barely tolerable for the kids. The staff was very accommodating, bar in center of hotel and a very nice breakfast buffet. Free to hilton members, but non member must pay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: starbean111
Reviews.Content: very convenient location, close to the mall, airport and downtown.. Friendly staff as well. Will stay again on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRho
Reviews.Content: Great Stay and perks with being a hilton Member. Great nice comfy rooms. Love the bed and the space. so close to the mall and the airport. will stay here again. Shuttle was good.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, good service”
Reviews.Author: beentherejohn
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient location right off the Freeway and only a block from the large Southcenter mall. Very good restaurants close by and a short shuttle ride to the airport. Friendly staff and a decent on-site restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: mmcgown
Reviews.Content: This is a high quality suites hotel in the Doubletree group, and it met all my expectations. At breakfast, all the diners were clearly getting ready for the business day. If you need to be near the airport but want to avoid the airport crowd, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOTa DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: 1960Cadillac
Reviews.Content: We were expecting to sleep in the same bed they have at the DoubleTree hotels, a sweet dreams bed. But these hotels that are called DoubleTree Suites, have hard beds. This hotel is older and has an open area in the middle that loudly amplifies all the noise coming from the bar below, so when you are trying to sleep at 11PM on a Friday night, you will hear all the noise. The first room they gave us had a ball of human hair on the couch, they gladly changed our rooms, but when they did, our next room did not have complimentary bottled water and the TV remote was broken. I never have a problem when I stay at the DoubleTree at S.F. Airport, but this was not the same. Also, the business center is widely used by local kids who are not even staying at the hotel ( I know this because their mother came in and told them they had to drive home now), so you have to wait for the hoodlums to stop using their facebook so that you, a paying customer, can actually print a business form.

Reviews.Title: “TOO DATED TO RETURN”
Reviews.Author: mycharlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Double Tree Hotel at Southcenter on 5 Jan 2012 and found the hotel not very pleasant. We stayed on the 7th floor and the hot water was a long time coming. The bathroom is very small and not what I expected from a suite room. The sink is out in the bedroom which is ackward if you need to get a drink of water in the middle of the night. The room, although clean, was quite dated and showed signs of too much wear. The lobby atrium open to the roof allowed noise to travel up from the bar on the main floor to our 7th floor room. The breakfast was quite pleasant in the morning and we appreciated the fine service. The hotel needs a complete make over before we will consider this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business and Leisure”
Reviews.Author: beachretirement
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip and thoroughly enjoyed our room, the staff and the facilities. I had stayed here 10 years ago and the hotel is definitely updated since then and the cleanliness of the rooms and facilities are great. The pool was an indoor heated pool, which was a little on the cold side. Great clean gym and pool and a lovely coffee shop on site as well. Great for kids too.

Reviews.Title: “Its 'Family-friendly' tradition continues.”
Reviews.Author: PaddingtonTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as a part of our family trip. We selected this hotel solely because of its proximity to SEA-TAC airport and the Sounthcenter Mall, and did not expect much from the hotel. I was wrong! While some facilities such as hallways, walls and carpets were bit old and thus need to be refitted soon, the staff mambers (esp. ladies at the front desk) were consistently of top quality from check-in to check-out. I rembered that we had stayed there in 1998 and they had taken care of our baby who is now a high school student. I believe that its 'family-friendly' tradition still continues and hope that we can come back again for both business and pleasure. As this is an all-suite hotel, rooms are wide enough to accomodate a family of four. Wi-fi is equipped in each suite.

Reviews.Title: “These Guys Block Netflix and limit TV to make you buy their movies”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel with caveats. Nice older hotel, but not up to date with limited electrical outlets (no bars furnished) and they block Netflix. Really a tacky way of doing business. I will look for somewhere else next time or preload my computer with what I want to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny E
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to meet your needs. The hotel itself isn't 'brand new' but it's the people who make your stay memorable. Especially Terry Lynn: at the front desk ready to check you in so fast/at the end of the phone when you're at the airport calling for a pick up/or calling from your room to ask for a recommendation/or when stopping by the front desk in need another one fo those cookies... She is outstanding!!! Staff like this is why I'll come back when I need a hotel in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: Quite decent older airport hotel with easy access to a variety of shops & restaurants. Not really luxurious but certainly does its job without issues. Review based on a one night stay in December’11 (background of spending 80+ nights per year in different hotels around the globe) Location: Location IMHO very good for an airport hotel, close enough to avoid lengthy travel from/to the airport but still middle of a major shopping (Macy’s, Nordstrom, REI, Best Buy etc) & eating (such as Outback Steakhouse, Sizzler, Simply Thai) offered by the Southcentre Mall, including also big movie theatre. Of course it would be faster to a hotel directly attached to the airport, but this one was still accessible enough with the big advantage of being easily use also other means of wasting your time than just sitting in the hotel bar. Shuttle bus to the airport runs every 30min, taking about 10min to get there. Room: Room was large with separate living & sleeping room sections, though the bathroom was very small. Décor was rather outdated, no major stains of usage though. The room was very clean. Some noise from the highway close by, otherwise the room was a quiet place. Etc: Quite good breakfast with a decent selection. Nothing really special as such but certainly enough to get your day started. Atrium design of the hotel offered an interesting point of view to the lobby & restaurant. Would I return there? Yeah sure if I ever need to stay a night at SeaTac ever again. Three stars doesn’t imply it’s a bad hotel, just not quite up to my four star standards, nothing to complain about though

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Northvan1269
Reviews.Content: Good location close to shopping and restaurants. Decor is very tired and badly in need of update. Woke up to a cold room with water running off the windows, called to the front desk who let us know the controls are in the closet. Bathroom small, cramped very basic but clean. We have a suite, the bedroom is adequate, the sitting room is furnished with a very odd sort of furniture that simply does not suit the room. Given there are three of us, an iPod dock on the clock would have been nice, I feel expected. We are staying for another night because it is too much hassle to pack up and move. Next time, I will stay somewhere else. Lots of choices at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Southcentre Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: skinnermick
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in an excellent position for Southcentre Mall and loads of good restaurants within a short walk. All suite hotel with great rooms but try to avoid rooms on the side the dumpster visits in the early hours. Airport pick up and drop off is a godsend as no drink drive worries, have used this hotel many times for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways”
Reviews.Author: Peggy B
Reviews.Content: I am delighted to give a review for the Doubletree Suites Southcenter Parkway in Seattle. The Staff is professional and warm. Steve, Rebecca and Janita at front desk are always helpful. Michael, manager of food and banquets knows me, and each year assists me with my product room set-up, this year Anthony was enthusiastic and most supportive in helping me with this task. Byron and Kim and the staff In the Northwest Landing are always so friendly, remembering me and are prompt with my orders. I love this hotel,in all my travels this hotel feels like home. When ever I am in Seattle this is my place to stay. I always get my favorite room, which is clean and welcoming and has a great view of Mt Rainer. Peggy Black

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, close to airport and mall”
Reviews.Author: KLEwing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here because the event we were attending was also at the hotel. Our rate was part of a package for the event, so I can't speak to whether the hotel is a good deal or not. But our room was very nice. The living space was separate from the bedroom. Great for a family with kids. The room had a tv in each space and a small fridge, but no microwave. There was no free Wifi, but there were 3 computers in the lobby that were free to use. Oh, and there is a small pool, which is sort of hidden and a work out room. The hotel is right across the street from Southcenter Mall and a block from Target. It would be a great splurge if you wanted to hit the mall or other stores early for some shopping. The construction that was going on is finished. Seatac airport is very close and there is a shuttle to take you there.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey smell in room 1831 and bra left in drawer”
Reviews.Author: AnakeRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree on the Remembrance Day long weekend with a shopping bus tour from Kelowna. We got our keys for 1831 and went upstairs. We opened the door and I was overwhelmed by cigarette smoke smell. I have asthma and I couldn't stay in there 10 seconds. After getting a second room (1801) we were a little disturbed when we found a bra in the drawer under the TV. The salmon dinner we had on the Friday night was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for staying near airport. The suites are roomy”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl084
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate online through hotels.com ($99 per night). Would advise travelers to check out other websites first tho- since they charged us for all 7 nights up front in order to get the $99 rate. This hotel also holds a security/amenities amount of $40 per day then reimburses you a few days after departure. Some aspects of room were old (bath tub and sink) and the heater did not work so well. Otherwise it was a comfortable spacious room. Tully's coffee in lobby was great. Walking distance to some restaurants and a huge mall with movie theater. Appreciated airport shuttle. Had to go to another Hilton hotel for laundry facility.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: elh76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated somewhat close to the airport. There was a lot of construction nearby when I stayed and while it was just off of I-5 it was kind of tucked away and hidden from the road. The room was average, nothing to write home about (or to TA!). I did not eat here and arrived fairly late; it was dark and I have no idea what was nearby. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was clean but nothing stood out to me as spectacular. Maybe I'm not giving it a fair shot since others seem to really love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin B
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel at which you want to stay! The front desk staff is friendly, personable, and very welcoming--particularly Mona, Shelly, Steve, Teri Lynn, and Jeremy. I regularly stay at this hotel every time I am in the Seattle area (for graduate school) and always enjoy my Doubletree Southcenter experience. The highlight of my stays, however, are my interactions with the airport shuttle driver, Asman. He is one of the kindest human beings I've ever met--and I've met a lot of human beings all over the world! I find myself hoping Asman is working when the hotel shuttle arrives promptly to pick me up. He is from Ethiopia and is working very, very hard and his family is still back in Ethiopia. We discuss all sorts of things on our rides to and from the hotel. I even mentioned that I loved Ethiopian food and he said, "Oh, well, I'll have to make you some Ethiopian some time!" So the next day, he brought some homemade Ethiopian food to me in my room! I couldn't believe it and hope the hotel recognizes this is the kind of employee that hotels want for a good customer service experience. The entire Doubletree staff is great and I recommend this hotel to every customer looking for a great place to stay in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay During A Family Birthday”
Reviews.Author: PropellerJourney
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on 10/22/2011 after a long driving experience. The in Hotel restaurant was closed as it was after the lunch hours. We were directed to the Bar that also serves food from the lunch menu. Our drink and lunch orders were take very fast. A short time latter our lunch arrived. It was very good with drink refills without request–a great sign of good service. Our room was big, an entry room with TV, microwave, refrigerator, bar area and convertible sofa bed. The main bedroom had the sink outside of the bathroom–a great thing when your wife drys her hair. The bathroom and rest of the suite was very clean with no issues detected. The soundproof walls and ceiling provides a quiet sleep environment that we enjoyed. During our stay, there were meetings and conferences being held that did not affect our quiet room. I would recommend this Hotel as it's all a traveler desires at a reasonable cost. The parking area is good but do not leave "stuff" visible in your vehicle. When in the area again, we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience at the Double Tree Guest Suites in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gary L
Reviews.Content: All aspects of my stay at the Double Tree Guest Suites on Southcenter Parkway were exceptional. Greeted promptly and courteously during check-in despite exceptional workload and patrons on business with credit card problems. Room was spaciouse, emmaculate and very comfortable. Requests for items forgotten (toothpaste/brush) were promptly addressed. Food at the hotel restaurant was very good; staff was friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel; I know this is where I will stay during future visits in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Weekend at the Doubletree Southcenter”
Reviews.Author: michiganchris
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree Southcenter for three nights. Overall we had a nice stay and would stay again. This hotel is located in a large retail area near many stores and restaurants. It is about 10-15 minutes away from Seattle-Tacoma airport and is fairly easy to find. We were visiting friends in the city of Seattle as well as doing a couple of day trips to Mt. Rainier and Portland. We found the location ideal for getting to our different destinations without having to battle with too much traffic. This hotel looks like it was once an Embassy Suites. While it has the feel of being an older/established property, it is very well maintained and impeccably clean. Our suite had a large and comfortable bed, and the room was very quiet. The bathroom was a bit small and dated, but as it was just the two of us, it wasn't a huge deal. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and courteous. We had breakfast a couple of mornings in the hotel's restaurant. It was buffet style and quite good with a fairly large selection. I'd recommend this hotel for people that do not have to stay in the city or right next to the airport. It has convenient access to the area freeways, and is quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl029
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Doubletree Guest Suites and it was just wonderful. The staff were all very helpful. The suite was very nice and the bed oh so comfortable. Of course the hot chocolate chip cookie at checkin was thouroughly enjoyed. I also appreciated the close proximaty to the Southcenter Mall and all the great restaurants there. Thanks for the great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable rooms with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: cbrooke03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when my mother was in town for a visit. I really liked the layout of the suites, however the sleeper sofa wasn't all that comfortable but ok for a nights stay. The rooms were very clean and cozy. We really liked the location of the hotel, as it was in close proximity to many restaurants and a lot of shopping. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful when we inquired about restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “WWII Veterans Reunion & Banquet”
Reviews.Author: A T
Reviews.Content: In organizing the reunion, we worked with staff that was very attentive to our special needs for veterans. The overall staff was very friendly and courtesy in taking care of the veterans. The hotel was in an excellent location for various restaurants and shopping. If any small concerns came up they were resolved in a timely manner. The banquet food and service were outstanding. They were able to maintain excellent food quality for 150 people and provide meals for special dietary limitations. Compliments to the chef. Several people commented that this was the best banquet that they had attended. You should consider this hotel for your reunion needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to see your elderly mother to the airport”
Reviews.Author: KristiWashington
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Sept. 20th. Never having stayed at any Doubletree before, my Mom and I both agree what an excellent choice it was. I picked it for proximity to Southcenter and to the airport, as I was seeing my mom off on a flight the next day. We wanted to shop and have comfort, good food and a good rest before she flew out. The first thing, upon check in, that we wanted was good food. We had driven 3 hours and were tired/hungry. We were informed the dining room didn't open till 5. We weren't informed about any other food option, not that we would have taken it, because mom was tired and just wanted to eat in the hotel. So I went to the bar area for some wine. I sat inside the bar area and eventually caught the interest of the bartender. There were two people, a man and woman, floating around and in and out of the bar area. Both ignored me for a few minutes. They were, however, very interested in all the bar patrons ordering food/appetizers. Finally the man took my order. Then, I unknowingly took my wine outside the bar area to sit (officially the lobby area I guess.) This was a serious break with protocol apparently. The bartender/gestapo agent informed me I was outside the boundary and to give him a credit card for the tab and that the bar was inside the little fence. Excuse us! By that time my elderly Mom was there and we moved inside the fence for our wine. All in all - not too impressed with the bar. Please have your bar staff be more attentive if a customer shows up. Acknowledge us right away! And if a person if having wine quietly, six inches outside the fence, call off the dogs and leave them in peace! Don't assume they will run out the door without paying or whatever. Then we moved into the dining area where everything was without exception excellent! The waiter was so personable, friendly and accomodating and smiling. His whole demeanor exuded friendly customer service, "we're so happy you're here dining with us and how can we help you.". The food was excellent. We asked why no one else was there. He wasn't entirely sure. But he waited on us, his only patrons, and he was superb that night. Our food was excellent. It was expensive, but worth it. We knew things were pricey there. We were happy to pay for good food and a good place. I would suggest to hotel patrons to eat right there. Awesome waiter - worth his pay and his generous tip! Now let's talk about Steve Messer the manager. Steve was absolutely awesome. When I showed up at the desk, he was juggling two phones and what sounded like plenty of confusion. He was busy. Still, he was patient, friendly, concerned and diplomatic with the other demands of people standing there. He was above and beyond with excellent customer service. All the desk staff are also excellent. They helped us and reassured us about our shuttle needs to the airport. That I was accompanying mom on the shuttle to the airport, but that I would return to the hotel also using the shuttle and how to do that. Our room: Was excellent and comfy. I slept on the hide-a-bed due to have privacy and my own TV. It was comfortable. The fridge was humming too loud so I unplugged it. I did get some sounds and noise from the lobby area - not bad. The only thing is I wish we didn't get stuck with the room with the HVAC view out the window! We tried to see a "view", pulled back the curtains, only to see the HVAC equipment and hardly even any sky. Bummer! Overall, our stay was very good. Thank you. I/we would stay there again in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Short excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Flip f
Reviews.Content: I stayed there overnight, the next day I was going to Beijing, China, The hotel is located on the same property as a Outback Steakhouse. In the same immediate area there is a Target,a mall and many restaurants within walking distance. the free shuttle will get you there in about 10 to 15 minutes. Very clean but small bathrooms. the staff was good and somewhat knowledgeable. There is a Wendy's and McDonald's across the street. bed was soft, no bed bugs either, i always check. I will stay there again because I travel from SEA-TAC airport about 4 or 5 times a year. Good area and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Cecili
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to attend a business conference. Conference has been held twice here and it is due to the location for attendees from North County to the South County area. Sea Tac Airport is about 10 not more than 15 minutes away. Upon checkin they give you a warm delicious choc chip cookie. A nice touch. Having a suite for your room is so much nicer to spread out and you actually have a work space in another room. Also its nice to have a "living room" as such to entertain and visit with other attendees without always having to be in a common area downstairs. The beds were wonderful and the alarm clock was even user friendly! The bathroom was small but probably because it only contained the tub and toilet. The shower head was great and had enought water pressure. Can't say that for the toilet tho. The sink was outside of the bathroom in the room. Nice if you have two people getting ready at the same time, although I did not have to share. Granite countertop sink. My only negative is that there is no towel rack or hook by the sink for your washcloths. The towels were nice and big and soft. The windows open in the room, but there is a lot of noise, but the fresh air was nice. Conference room was roomy. Food could be improved, but then again feeding a large group I am sure is difficult. There is a bar in the lobby which is nice and roomy, but the service was not that great. Only one person working at the bar. Southcenter shopping mall across the street as well as other restaurants you can easily walk to. Parking Lot is dark at night and they really need more lighting out there. Right now lots of construction around the hotel, so beware. It is suppose to be done by the holidays so if you are not familar with the area, be prepared for detours. I am sure future conferences will be using this facility again.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: akabono
Reviews.Content: Pleasant room, comfortable bed, roomy sitting area and warm choclate chip cookies when you arrive. The only negative was that there were sessions for "Healing with Sound" going on and we could hear drums (sort of like the indian drums that you used to hear in Westerns) coming thru the AC duct until late evening. It was a bit annoying. Also, if the AC fan was off, you could hear voices thru the duct. The desk gave an excellent restaurant recommendation across the street ("Grazie") that we enjoyed. Note: Don't confuse with the Doubletree on International Drive, We did in our GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and friendly, but no gym on site.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainD1234
Reviews.Content: This place is big and clean and quiet. The guest rooms are very nice. Service is good. They really gouge you on the drink prices in the lounge. Airport shuttle helps. Free breakfast for Hhonors members.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Clean & Always a Yummy Cookie!”
Reviews.Author: LisaEaseTravels
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Doubletree for a workshop and I was very pleased with the overall attentiveness of the staff. My experience was that they worked as a team. It was refreshing to check-in to this hotel, after midnight, and be treated like family was welcoming me home. Aside from the staff, the accommodations were sufficient and comfortable. My room was always very clean and toiletries were supplied abundantly! The drawbacks for me were that the food in the restaurant was okay for the price and the walls were a little thin. However, with the endless supply of warm yummy cookies I could almost overlook those things! Lol! :)

Reviews.Title: “Our military reunion was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! That is all I have heard from our members about our accommodations at this fine hotel. From the front desk check-in to the shuttle returning all to the airport, the vote was unanimous! Our rooms; the service in all areas, particularly our hospitality room; the catering service/food & beverage services; the banquet meal, all were simply outstanding. Oh, there were a few glitches or hiccups, but they were handled in a most professional manner by the staff, and these anomalies were of no real consequence.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I were recent guests on 2 separate stays. The front desk was quick, efficient and remembered us on the second stay. We had to park bikes with the bell room and they were great about our very long tandem bike taking up lots of space. Hilton diamond breakfast was a very comprehensive buffet with healthy choices and some decadent ones as well, such as a really good biscuit and gravy. The bathroom is a bit tiny but the bowed shower curtain is a nice touch. The door between the front room and bedroom consists of louvers only. It slightly defeated the purpose of sheltering my son from the snoring noises in our room. It also doesn't block light from the nocturnal kids side from the old persons side. It would work much better with young kids as you can keep an ear and eye on their activity.

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree by Hilton Seattle Airport, SeaTac, Washington, United States”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker123452
Reviews.Content: Went to Seattle on a shopping trip and stayed here for one night. It's about a 15 minute drive to downtown Seattle and close to Westfield, Mall. Great reception, friendly,helpful staff. Check in was quick and we were treated to warm, chocolate chip cookies, they even asked how many we wanted! The room was clean and large and even though we were on the first floor facing the front of the hotel/parking lot there were trees/shrubs planted in front of the deck to give the illusion of green space, large deck too. The beds were very comfortable. There was a beautiful, large outdoor pool with lots of deck space for sunning and a small hot tub. We didn't check out the fitness room but it looks okay on the webpage. I would recommend this hotel. Also, if you go on a shopping excursion check out Nordstrum Rack, about 5 mins from the hotel and try Elliott's in Seattle for dinner, on the waterfront, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in in one of Seattle's nicest shopping areas”
Reviews.Author: Mort69
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price for what we got. 1 bedroom suite Wirh lots of room, gorgeous lobby with restaurant and bar. Loads of close by shopping, restaurants and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveH250
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the first part of a trip around Washington and Oregon and it was a great hotel. In some places a little tired looking, wrinkled carpets, paint a little tired in places but you know what that's all I can say that's negative (and that's not a lot) - this hotel was great. Great cookies at reception, right across the road from the mall and the Cheese Cake factory, friendly staff, it was clean and the room had a great layout with a separate sitting area and two TV's (no arguments from the kids on what to watch - woohooo!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Was great and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Niki47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July and it was fine. The kids swam in the indoor pool and had fun. The rooms were clean and quiet. I'm a Hilton Honors member so Wi-Fi was free. Chocolate chip cookies were there when we arrived. There is shopping and resturants, (from Outback to McDonalds) within walking distance but we didn't get a chance to eat at either the resturants or the hotel. We also didn't make use of the airport shuttle. If you needed something there is a Target and large mall just around the corner. I'd recommend it, especially if you have children. We had two beds in one room and the sofa in the living room area made into a bed. Microwave, and small fridge in the living area too. The bathroom sink was in the bedroom so the bathroom was very small which made it difficult to monitor the little ones shower but we managed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice right during construction”
Reviews.Author: nollvis33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a conference . The hotel was ok . The good part was it is next to a mall and movie theatres and restaurants galore. The problem was there was majror construction going on in front of the hotel so going anywhere became very difficult. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the bar is in a atrium and closes at 11pm . The rooms were old but clean. Since the bar is open the sound travels. All and all it was a descent trip . Probably would stay a little closer to Seattle next time .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to shopping”
Reviews.Author: Atimonan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel around Christmas of last year. We stayed in a big one bedroom suite, with a living area with a mini fridge, a small dining table with four chairs and a little sink. A nice comfy bed!! Nice spacious closet and in the same room with double sink and a separate room for the bathtub and toilet. I like the amenities like swimming pool, a sauna, jacuzzi tub, and a big spacious workout room. The hotel is across Southcenter mall, nice restaurants like Cheesecake Factory, Olive Garden, Outback, Claim Jumper, Spaghetti Factory, Red Robins and so many more. It's about 10 min. ride from the airport and about 15 min drive to downtown Seattle. Free parking. If you like Filipino food!! There is a Seafood City, Valerio Bakery, Chow King, Red Ribbon and I can't think of the Chicken place, in one corner across JC Penney. I almost forgot our room came with free breakfast!! Two flat screen televisions, one in the bedroom and one in the living room with a sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful space to work with”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunnah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on business. The workspace is excellent with adequate desk space and lighting. Additionally you can close off the bedroom space if you need to work. The staff were friendly and helped me navigate the Seattle public transportation (Light Rail link). They also provided very helpful restaurant recommendations. The hotel is situated near a shopping area so there are many choices for food. The only issue that I had was it was a bit noisy on the last night I stayed (Friday) due to events occuring in the hotel. Also, I was given a lower floor room when my request was for a high floor. Other than that, I would say it is an excellent place to book for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you have kids.”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my kids. The two-room layout with the sofabed makes that effort a bit less of a challenge. The staff was outstanding, from the desk clerks to the breakfast attendants to the shuttle drivers. However, the hotel considers itself to be an airport property, and since they offer a shuttle then that's an acceptable idea. However, if you are driving, know that the hotel is quite a bit off the beaten path to/from SeaTac, and that there is substantial road construction in the area of Southcenter Mall. We did ultimately find it - and liked the property. A couple of things bothered me; ostensibly we were in a nonsmoking room, but it REEKED of smoke. Housekeeping should have notified management, the TV in the bedroom had horrible reception - that should have been taken care of by someone prior to check-in (although we did figure out that it was just a loose cable in the back of the set). Parking seems limited and quite a way from the front door. These issues were minor and I would quite readily return. While there is nothing outstanding about the hotel, it offers a pleasant atmosphere, and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight only”
Reviews.Author: Sandbuilder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good to spend a night going to or coming from the airport but I wouldn't recommend it for any longer stay. The rooms are clean but quite dated as others have noted. It's hard to even find an outlet to charge your ipod over night. The staff is pleasant but services are limited. It is very noisy because of the open atrium design. It is convenient to the airport but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that mean a lot”
Reviews.Author: larao68
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night here but i would highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is walking distance to southcenter mall and target. Very nice suite at a reasonable price. Check-in and check out couldnt have been easier. right now there is a lot of road constuction going on around the mall. Not the hotels fault, but be aware. Little things like nice warm cookies at check-in and free Internet for being a hilton honors member help me recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place--Loved the Cookies”
Reviews.Author: AlaskanTravellor
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel. It was a great place to stay, and I LOVED the free cookies at Check-in. They're really addicting. I loved the suite, it was really clean and I loved the pool. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Professional with a Home Feeling”
Reviews.Author: motabsinger
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, kind staff, clean rooms, quiet and close to restaurants. Shuttle from airport or only 10 min with a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, clean rooms, fantastic views... Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTimeTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business meeting that ended up being canceled. It was a nightmare trip as the flights were rescheduled... 3 times and I had to keep going back-forth to the airport, etc. However, the staff were very friendly and helpful and allowed me to stay in my room for an hour longer w/out charge. Also, they arranged all travel to/from the airport, which was extremely helpful!! My room had a great view. It was spacious and clean as was the bathroom. My bed linens and towels were all clean and like new condition. The food at the hotel was good and the overall atmosphere was lovely! My boss paid for this trip so I can not comment on the hotel expenses/value as I'm not sure how much it all cost; however, I can say the staff were very friendly, the location was convenient, and the hotel was very clean and welcoming. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would highly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable, upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schrutefan08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Doubletree twice this year, and both times found our stay very satisfactory. The customer service is good, and the employees were patient and hospitable. Delicious, complimentary cookies were provided for us when we checked in. The hotel itself is very big, and has a great spa and pool, with a large, well equipped fitness room. There is an internet cafe in the lobby, complete with computers free to use, and a gift shop. Our suite was lovely, with a living room, bathroom, bedroom, spacious closet and 2 televisions. The restaurant downstairs was nice enough, with some good choices on the menu. Our only complaint was that during one night of our stays, the elevator needed maintenance and the other one was unavailable, so we had to climb 6 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Saints81
Reviews.Content: My reservation experience with Laurel was awesome. I am unfamiliar with Seattle and she sent me numerous emails to help me with getting a shuttle to the hotel from the airport, get a rental car, directions, and many other things....all unrequested and unsolicited (I just kept getting one email from her after another loaded with info and needed phone numbers for my trip) She even called me twice to give me rental car advice. I felt so bad because something unexpected came up and I had to cancel my reservation...BUT my son is going to start UW in the fall and I will be traveling up there from Florida often. No doubt I will be staying at this Hotel. That kind of service and going beyond the call of duty is rare these days and it is something I look for when looking for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, best I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: boscoe11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular hotel at least 50 days so far in 2011. I have introduced a minimum of six of my colleagues to this hotel where we all stay. The facility is exceptional but what makes this the best hotel I have stayed at for any business travel is the staff. I along with my colleagues recommend this hotel to all of our co-workers. We have all been very impressed and very pleased with all aspects of our stays. Steve, Richard, Jeremy, Shelley, Daniel just to mention a few are exceptional managers and staff members. Please feel free to contact me for any additional comments. 480-273-2585

Reviews.Title: “walls paper-thin; dated”
Reviews.Author: vanabb
Reviews.Content: Staff are trying; hotel needs updating. You can hear every word of conversation from the rooms next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at check-in!”
Reviews.Author: shopper82108812
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the weekend of March 25, 2011. Jeremy handled my check-in efficiently and politely as there were may guests wating to check-in. He accomodated all of my requests and made my stay very enjoyable. On a previous trip, Steve checked me in with the same treatment. These two gentlemen really understand customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: K8wash
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights while on business. My biggest complaint was in regards to the 24 hour shuttle. Myself and a colleague waited for the shuttle at the airport for 45 minutes, which is ridiculous, considering the hotel is less than 10 minutes away. It was 12:30 in the afternoon, which wasn't during peak traffic times, so I feel there should be no excuse. To compensate, we received free appetizer vouchers to eat at the on-site restaurant, as well as a free in-room movie. While initially this sounded okay, we discovered that 6 out of 7 of the appetizers were seafood, and I do not eat seafood. Instead I received a $6 bowl of french onion soup, and paid $4 for a side salad containing mostly iceberg lettuce. The service was mediocre at best. Other than that, the pool and spa were nice, as well as the workout room. I enjoyed the clock radio iPod capability as well. The room was large and sufficient for my needs. I may go here again, providing I have my own transportation the next time around and will eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knutson_11
Reviews.Content: The location cant be beat on this hotel. It isnt right on the airport strip, but they offer the shuttle that takes less then 10 minutes and I thought that was great. The fact we could stay at a place that is within the block of a huge mall and many great restauraunts was a huge perk to me. As for the accomadations I felt they were so so, my biggest problem was i decided to spend an extra 30 bucks on the room just to have a little nicer accomadations and when I got to my room it was right at the level of a rooftop on the 2nd floor, and we had one of the main heat pumps right next to our bedroom window, figuring I would not get any sleep the night before my flight I did request a move and they accomidated very quickly, but I was a little bummed that that is what paying extra gets you. But all in all it was a pretty good stay, and for an airport stay and what it has around it I will definately go back, just not pay for any upgrade...

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for layover with family (or shopping!)”
Reviews.Author: AAL08 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Suites is a good choice for an overnight layover in Seattle, especially with kids -- or for shopping! The living room and the bedroom are separated by a door, so when traveling with kids, it's a great choice. (Even if you're not traveling with kids, this layout means that there is no hallway noise in the bedroom.) The airport shuttle is free and runs 24 hours. My only (relatively minor) complaint is that the shuttle leaves the hotel on a schedule (every 30 minutes). We needed to be at the airport by 5:00 a.m., which meant that we had to take the 4:30 shuttle, which arrived at the airport about 4:40. We would have liked that extra 20 minutes of sleep! We asked for a different departure when we checked in at 10:30 p.m. but the answer was no. It was a short night! We've also stayed at the Doubletree Suites when we've been flying into Seattle for a short stay involving shopping. It's across the street from a great mall.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Suites seattle - Southcenter for New Years”
Reviews.Author: MorganOJones
Reviews.Content: As Canadians, we travel south to Seattle on a somewhat regular basis for leisure - shopping mostly. In addition, we have made it a tradition, along with another family to go to Seattle for New Years. We always stay at the Doubletree Suites at Southcenter. This past New Years (2010/2011) was no exception. We stayed two nights, Dec. 30 & 31st. - the rates given were excellent and included a very good buffet breakfast. The staff are very helpful - Steve the manager is very, very good. I stay in hotels well in excess of 100 nights per year and the staff behind the front desk make all the difference. Steve and his crew are amongest the best. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel 2 nights every month for 1&1/2 Year”
Reviews.Author: kstreussnig
Reviews.Content: Being stationed in Alaska and having to see specialty doctors in Seattle, my husband and I stayed at this hotel at least 2 nights a month for over a year and a half....I have raynauds and my room was to cold for me...so they helped me move to another room with a warmer working heater.and this was in the middle of the night...Anytime I asked for anything they went out of their way to help me....also being a Hilton Honors member which is simple to fill out online, I always got internet free plus I accrued free stays...we stayed a few nights over to watch the Yankees play and it was free using our rewards. Parking is always free and you are only a block away from the mall and gas station....It was also conveniently located near I-5 which made it easy to get around town for my various appointments...they also have a family style breakfast that has the Best Staff so its convenient to buy breakfast and they also have an internet cafe that serves the best coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location for Navy Ship Reunion!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfpack81
Reviews.Content: My Father-in-Law's ship reunion was booked at this particular hotel, and most of the attendees stayed here. I came along as his escort. A buffet dinner, a reception as well as a banquet were all hosted by this hotel, so we had ample opportunity to not only sample the cooking but also the hospitality shown to an older crowd (Vietnam era vets and earlier). The hospitality started when I first called to book the room. Jenita, the manager at the front desk, made a point of booking the reservation and giving me her name so that I could call back shortly before arrival to arrange for adjoining rooms. I later called and talked to Jeremy, who confirmed the rooms would be adjoining. Both were very helpful. We took the free shuttle from the airport after a long cross-country flight, and it was a clean and quick ride with a friendly, attentive driver helping the older passengers. Check-in was very smooth (great front desk on Sept. 30th!), and we were even able to check in early to allow my Father-in-Law a chance to rest. The meals were excellent; my Father-in-Law is a retired chef (and former Navy cook), and he was very complimentary of all the meals received at the hotel. It takes great food to impress him -- the one night we ate out (at the Cheesecake Factory across from the hotel) he complained about the food quality. The staff went out of their way to make sure everything went well, and I was especially touched when the wait staff was moved to tears while listening to the stories of departed Navy comrades. To a person (and there were nearly 40 of us) I heard nothing but compliments about the quality of the rooms. They were impressed by the suite design and the affordable rates granted to our group -- especially important to many on a fixed budget. I personally witnessed the quick, caring actions of the hotel staff when a guest (not with our group) experienced a medical emergency the last night we were there. They actually stationed people along a route to guide the emergency responders directly from the curb to the room of the person in distress. The proximity to a major shopping mall, as well as light rail transit and the airport, simply added to the satisfaction our group felt for having spent three days here. A reunion can be made or broken by the accommodations provided, and this hotel made this a reunion to remember fondly!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: GinaK2
Reviews.Content: well im a bike racer and i had a big race going on that weekend so we decided to stay here it was so AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “This was an overnight stop following a...”
Reviews.Author: Coastal_Plainer
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stop following a long flight. Check in went well with a short wait and payment was made by way of honor points. The room was on the 4th floor and had a separate lounge and family bedroom. We found the situation with the sink in the bedroom area in other hotels on this trip so it does not disturb us. We could hear sounds from outside but even though there was a class reunion at the hotel there was no noise. We had breakfast which was an extra cost but we were seated promptly and the meal was good. Location was great for the mall and other shopping but cannot be considered for visiting central Seattle which is why I have scored the location as such. Did not get a chance to get in the pool which looked good and parking was adequate. Overall this was great and depending on price would have liked to stay longer or on another occasion should it arise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport or shopping”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Seatac airport. If you wish to see the sights of central Seattle it might not be for you as it will involve a drive on busy freeways and expensive parking each day. However if you came to shop this is the place. It is right by the biggest shopping mall in the Pacific Northwest with a huge variety of stores and restaurants nearby as well as a cinema with Imax. In spite of being close to the I5 the hotel was quiet and the rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Good value if the location suits you.

Reviews.Title: “Got a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Dalotek
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get-away for a weekend. Went to Priceline and selected the Renton-Kent are just south of Seattle and got the Doubletree Southcenter. We were positively surprised about the nice flair of the hotel. Totally open atrium and rooms are accessed from the inside. Roomy mini suite. Bedroom with TV, window and an extra room with couch, TV, fridge, coffee maker, desk. It measured about 600 sq ft. Very convenient. Just off I5, but you hardly hear the traffic. Southcenter mall is adjourned. Ikea is not far away and you have plenty of fast food and dining choices around there without driving at all. Nice swimming pool and hot tub. They also have two Racquetball courts which we used. That was great! Staff was friendly, nice atmosphere in the hotel, free parking. However, you have to pay for internet access in the room, but they also have computers next to their coffee shop for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: athenabee
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel. We weren't really in the hotel too much though, every night we'd come in and go to sleep. The staff seemed very friendly, and they gave us discounts and free cookies. It was a great price for the room we got, only $110 per night! For that price, you get a lot. BUT, later we found out that the hotel charged us 40 dollars extra a night just in case we decided to touch the mini bar in the room. Which we didn't. And, they charged us without saying ANYTHING. Even on the bill, it had not included the extra $40 a night. But after a couple angry phone calls, they removed the charges. So, alls well that ends well there. The hotel is in a great location if you want to go to Southcenter and do some shopping. It's a little too far if you go to Seattle everyday though. Overall, I think this would be a good hotel for someone just passing through, maybe on the way to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't... no couldn't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: much2buzy
Reviews.Content: I truly would not stay at this hotel again. The rooms were far from sound proof. They tried to update the bathroom by putting in a stone counter top but that is it. The toilet/shower area had 70's wallpaper and didn't look to clean. I slept on a sofa sleeper and I think the floor would have been more comfortable. The sheets were like putting pieces of cardboard over you plus the blanket had little holes all over it. This was probably the worst night sleep of my life! I couldn't stay at this location again! However, I must add that all staff that we came in contact with were incredibly friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not a way to end your Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: steffi26
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first night and the last night of our Honeymoon in this hotel. The first time was pretty nice and we felt very welcomed, however, the second time was just misrable. The receptionist was rude, the bedding was not clean, a dirty face cloth lay on the side of the bath tube and when I complained, I did not get the reply for 2 weeks. After chasing, I received a reply and was promissed a free stay - the voucher never arrived and after following up twice, I gave up. Not a great place to stay for over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: WylM5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location, you are within walking distance to a very large shopping center called the Westfield Southcenter -copy the following: http://westfield.com/southcenter/ just about anything you could want in a large shopping center and there are also lots of places to eat within walking distance- including a Outback steakhouse that shares the same parking lot. Drive time to downtown Seattle is 15-20 minutes and I visited a few times including Safeco field, Uwajiyama, REI and of course Pike Market. The hotel itself has nice large rooms with very comfortable beds. I did not experience any noise problems as some other reviews have noted but I was in a room that faced away from the highway so you may wish to ask for a room on that side of the hotel. You should also know that there seems to be only one set of elevators for the hotel, if you park on the side facing the highway (next to Outback) you will need to walk thru their restaurant to get to them. They charge for wifi but you can still catch a weak signal from the coffee shop or another account named dbletree mgt or similar. At 200 a night though this place is on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: justdoinmypart
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline when I bid $50 and I was very pleased. We had a two room, 1 bathroom suite. The beds were full size and not queen but they were very comfortable. Nice thick bath towels. Clean. Didn't eat at restuarant in hotel but it looked nice. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Great location. Close to the airport without all the airport noise. Hotel had open floor concept. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night prior to an early morning flight out of Sea-Tac. I have stayed at many Doubletree's over the years & am generally pleased with them. This one, however, does have a nit-picks I need to mention. First off, the windows in the bedrooms, at least in my room, could do w/some sound-proofing. The hotel is right off a busy highway & the traffic noise could be heard quite clearly all night. Walls seem to be very thin, too-we clearly heard the baby next door, even when not expressing its displeasure about something, all night. Each 'suite' is actually 3 rooms-the living room, right off the interior corridor, a combination dressing/bathroom, & then the bedroom. While there is a door between the living room & bathroom, there is no door between the bathroom & bedroom. Unfortunately, the sink is actually outside of the shower/toilet (which does have a door), so anyone trying to dress, etc., & use the sink is going to wake the person trying to sleep. Breakfast, according to my room-mate, was adequate. Dinner, from room service seemed over-priced; $40+ for a salad, bowl of soup, & quesadilla?? Beds, the most important part, were wonderfully comfy &, in the end, that's what counts, I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the value!”
Reviews.Author: friendly_planner
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit spendy, but worthe the price! The rooms were large, clean and set-up perfectly. The breakfast bar downstairs was outstanding, the staff were very helpful and the catering staff for our event at the hotel filled our every need. The parking is free and it's located in the greatest spot. There is a movie theater, tons of restaurants and a mall located within walking distance. And it's right off the freeway!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: usarmymom
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel room, but big problems with their billing process. My sister and I split the bill about $300.00 a piece. I asked the desk clerk about midway through our 4 night stay if we could do this. She said yes and then changed her mind after swiping my card and told me that we would have to wait until we checked out. No problem. But by swiping my card, she charged 139.00 to my card. Then when we checked out I had a 294.00 charge on my card (which was the correct amount). Now three days later I still have a 300.00 pending charge on my card??? When I talked with the desk clerk, she didn't seem to see the problem. In the meantime, my sister also had a 750.00 hold on her card. So all in all, they have held or charged about 1600.00 for a 4 night stay. Makes no sense to me? I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, in fact the least hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: BA-traveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we parked our car in front of the hotel to unload our luggage. I went inside to get a luggage cart, and saw two bellboys very busy talking to each other. They didn’t offer any assistance until we were inside. And then we refused of course. At check-in we didn’t get an upgrade for being Diamond HHonors members, slightly disappointing. They also didn’t put us on the highest level. Our suite had two rooms, not very spacious, but still in reasonable order. There was a living area with sofa, easy chair, side table and working desk with chair, also a unit with refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was very small, but it was clean and the sink was outside. The sleeping room had a good quality King bed. Here we had a window with a nice view on a park. The business center is an open area next to the sandwich shop. There were three computers, I had to wait several times, they were mostly in use as it was busy in the hotel. The swimming pool is inside and looks very old. Unfortunately there is no patio outside or whatever. The weather was sunny and I went to the park, just next to the hotel. There I could find nice seating to relax and read my book. There is a large Mall on walking distance and also a Target very close by. In the evening we had dinner in the restaurant and after that we were very sorry that we did. There were two waiters, acting very popular and making silly old jokes, so we didn’t feel comfortable and taken seriously or treated as welcoming guests. For instance, when we walked in, the restaurant was empty (except for one table) and when we wanted to sit down, a waiter came and told us: No, no, no, this table is reserved!!! Just after a minute or so, he continued: Yes, this table is specially reserved for you…………….. and the whole evening was a continuation of these sick phrases. The food wasn’t of high quality either. The breakfast the next morning was even worse. It looked all very cheap, not much variety and all the hot items were far to fat. Although the hotel is not to blame for the standards of their guests, we didn’t like it that many people came crisscross to the restaurant area on their way from and to the elevators. There were one or more groups who had their breakfast in the conference center; many people packed their items to bring it back to their room, they all went through the restaurant. We even saw people still in their pajamas, wearing a coat over it. So, in de end we regret choosing this hotel for our last night before our departure from Seattle airport. The rooms are slightly outdated, but further okay, for the rest there is much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: NVLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: Airport shuttles available but chose to rent car. Sits behind Outback Steakhouse. Unobtrusive to the eye from street. Wide covered entryway when raining. On entering the first thing you see is a computer screen facing you at the counter with large scrolling print letting you know it is for your boarding pass printing. Very impressed with that. The icons were of most every airline. On check in we received a warm, large and delicious cookie for each of us. After a long flight it was yummy. The large bed was super soft and comfy. Loved the quilted duvet cover. We were warm and comfy all night. Amenities - refrigerator, living room/TV area, couch, soft chairs, computer desk, & microwave delivered if asked for. Friendly personnel from check-in to check-out. Elevator ran smoothly and quickly. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree - Paper-thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: Maui_rox
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here April 11 - 13th as we wanted a little rest & relaxation away from the kids. My friend booked it as she stayed here years ago and really enjoyed it then. The room was ok, however the partition door to the living room could hardly be pulled closed. The TV in the bedroom was maybe a 19" - it seemed quite small compared to other hotels I've been to recently. The worst part of our stay started at 6:15 a.m. on the Saturday morning. We were awakened to an alarm beep going off. In trying to figure out where it was coming from, it kept getting louder and faster beeping. This went on for about 5 min., until I finally realized it was coming from the neighbor's suite next door. We called the front desk thinking that either no-one was in the suite or they were dead. The clerk could hear the noise through the phone. The front desk sent up the bellman who knocked on the door - they slept through that as well. Finally after another 5 min. of this annoying noise, it went off. Only to go off another 10 min later (they must've hit snooze). Since I was up anyhow, I went to the gym (which is the only thing nice about this hotel). My friend then said she could clearly hear the neighbor's conversation, coming through our walls. Meanwhile, I then spoke to the two girls at the front desk. I told them they have to move us if the people next door were not leaving today. The clerks said no problem they could see if there was anything on another floor. Upon getting to my room, I phoned to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. I was asked what it was regarding so that she could put me in touch with the right manager. She transferred me to Michael, who we later found out was the Food & Beverage Manager and not the Room Manager. Michael was very nice and apologized and assured me we would be put in another room upon us coming back to the hotel later that night. When we got back, we talked to Steve at the front desk who might've been a manager. His customer skills definitely needed work. He didn't smile once. He didn't apologize. In fact, he didn't even hear of our situation and seemed quite choked that we were making him move us. All he said was that he was looking for another room for us. We were not impressed with Steve! Upon getting our new room, the sink tap came right off, and there was no knob on the temperature control (we cooked all night) to turn. So much for a nicer room. We think this place is a joke as far as being classified as a Hilton. It's definitely lost our business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice hotel, great atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for this room before flying out to vegas. The airport shuttle ran a little late so plan for that (traffic is bad in area, not drivers or shuttles fault) we went early and got to airport in plenty of time The bed was the most comfortable I ever slept in! the rooms were nice, and big with a sitting area. The hotel had a nice atmosphere and I noticed alot of pilots staying there so it must be a good hotel. Overall it was a pleasant stay. The pool area was nice but we didnt venture down there to swim. drawbacks. the person before us left a laptop in the room, hotel staff didnt find it, and my son found a roll of duct tape under the bed. what is duct tape used for in a hotel room? Makes me wonder how good they cleaned the rooms. They seemed and smelled cleaned to me but you never know. We ordered room service which was so-so, and we had ordered pizza and they ran out. When we didnt get our pizza we had to call and ask why. Room service didnt charge us for our small meal, which made up for it. This hotel had a great atmosphere and was quite busy but still quiet. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fiveinthefamily
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay if you want shuttle service to and from the airport and a place to leave your vehicle while you vacation. The shuttle buses left on time and we had very little wait before they picked us up at the airport. Good rates and pretty nice suites. We were on the fold out (our kids were in the beds!!) and I would say that the fold out was one of the most comfortable that I've slept on. A nice surprise. They have an indoor pool, which we didn't use. Their location is good if you're looking to find a restaurant or go shopping. Lots of options within walking distance. You each get a cookie upon check in. They are really tasty! Slightly warm, gooey and a pretty big one at that. The sink is just outside the bathroom, which is a good design. A TV in the livingroom and the bedroom. I would return if we fly out of Seattle again for a vacation or if I'm a tourist in Seattle for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Slept through the storm”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCoug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in town for Seahawks game, also turned out to be the night of the BIG storm. At the airport the next day found out we we're one of the only ones who had power all night and the next day. The wind was crazy, but the room was still quiet enough that we slept right through it. Room was nothing special, nor was the breakfast buffet. Stay at the Embassy Suites nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 100 stays”
Reviews.Author: Traveler77777
Reviews.Content: Over the last 18 months I have stayed at this hotel almost 100 nights! It is an incredible place! Starting with Steve the night manager and ending with the best bacon on the breakfast buffet. The rooms are large and up to date, the place is clean and they are always replacing something (carpet, fixtures etc) to keep it up todate. I will always stay at this hotel when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Park'n fly”
Reviews.Author: CaptivatedTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night on our way to Hawaii. We parked our car there for 2 weeks. The room was clean and comfortable. We had no problems with our car. For the price, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Horrible Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: hadrian333
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel, the front desk personnel treated us as if they were doing us a favor to check us in. The actual hotel was moderately clean except that the interior is starting to look a bit dated. Our room was fine except the foldout bed was very uncomfortable for our son. This hotel charges for internet access by the day which is unheard of in this day and age. Although the parking was free, it is not secured. The towels they provide were small and didn't dry you very well after a shower. The rooms were relatively clean and the location was quiet in the evening. When we were checking out, there was a discrepency in our hotel room rate. Because they hurried us through the process, I decided to deal with that when I got home since we were late for our plane. After getting home, I tried contacting Doubletree by using their toll free number but their agent told us that I had to discuss this issue by calling their hotel in Washington which has no toll free number. When I called that number and payed the toll call, they were again not willing to discuss the discrepancy with my room rate so I pretty much gave up with them. I would have to think twice before going back to this hotel again. Their personnel at this hotel were the worst I have encountered in the 30 plus years that I have been traveling around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel with free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: tim805
Reviews.Content: Needed a family suite hotel for 1 night before leaving on our Alaska Cruise and this one did the job. Free shuttle from the airport and check in was very easy. Room was nice with a living room and bedroom on the 7th floor. We had breakfast in the hotel and the pricess were like anywhere else. My son and I used the indoor pool and it was nice and clean. Took the shuttle back to the airport and believe this hotel to be a good bargain and convient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Elm Street”
Reviews.Author: classiccars
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is not bad. The rooms are two room suites and the food is okay but not great. The problem is that our car was broken in during our three day stay. I contacted the front desk and told them about our break in and their attitude was "Oh really". I asked to speak to the Front Deck Manager and he never returned my call. obviously didn't care about our problem. After talking to some emplyees I found out that car break ins is quite the problem around this area. The property hires offsite security that only does a drive by during the late evening hours. Park your car here at your own risk or better yet stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Vehicle, no apologies”
Reviews.Author: tsherb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the end of a reverse park and fly . An employee had told me over the phone that the lots where I would be parking had video surveillance . Furthermore, someone drove around the parking area to check on the cars I parked near the entranceway two spots in . No information was taken about my vehicle so that they could check on its security while I was gone When we returned one week later my vehicle was gone . It had been stolen and severely vandalized. The employees had no apologies and when I called down to speak to the front desk to ask them to save the tapes of the video surveillance for the week, they told me there was no surveillance of that front area . The manager later defended what the employee had told me as being true for their back lots and further seemed irritated and annoyed with my phone call. I saw that I was getting nowhere with him and was ready to hang up when he offered to check some other video records and get back to me . He never called me back . My vehicle sustained $5,000.00 worth of damage . I don't recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AKfun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and found the experience nice. We only stayed two days this trip through and it was as expected. Room was clean and very comfortable. This hotel caters to the business sector and therefor is not marketed towards the tourist.We got a good rate by dropping in late one night but when we tried to extend our stay the price jumped beyond what I was willing to pay. That is too bad since they lost revenue when they had lots of rooms available. The business center is great and we used it a couple times. I am Hilton Honors and did not receive any extras. The internet was pricey but did work well and fast. Would stay here again, if the price was right.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Seattle Airport - Southcenter
HotelInfo.Address: 16500 Southcenter Pkwy., Seattle, WA 98188-3388
